sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 
Suppose if 
\[
	\frac{b + c - a }{j + k - i } = \frac{c + a - b }{k + i - j } = \frac{a + b - c }{i + j - k }
\]
then prove that each ratio is equal to 
\[
	\frac{a }{i } = \frac{b }{j } = \frac{c }{k }
\]
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "It is given that
\[
	\frac{b + c - a }{j + k - i } = \frac{c + a - b }{k + i - j } = \frac{a + b - c }{i + j - k }
\]
Each ratio can be given as 
\[
	= \frac{b + c - a + c + a - b + a + b - c }{j + k - i + k + i - j + i + j - k }
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
\[
	= \frac{a + b + c }{i + j + k }
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
Now, we can write
\[
	\frac{b + c - a }{j + k - i } = \frac{a + b + c }{i + j + k }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{b + c - a }{a + b + c } = \frac{j + k - i }{i + j + k }
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
Now, by dividendo rule we can write that
\[
	\frac{b + c - a - (a + b + c )}{a + b + c } = \frac{j + k - i - (i + j + k )}{i + j + k }
\]"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{-2 a }{a + b + c } = \frac{-2i }{i + j + k }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{a }{a + b + c } = \frac{i }{i + j + k }
\]"}, {"id": "s6", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{a }{i } = \frac{a + b + c }{i + j + k }
\]"}, {"id": "s7", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": " 
Similarly we can also prove that
\[
	\frac{b }{j } = \frac{a + b + c }{i + j + k }
\]
\[
	\frac{c }{k } = \frac{a + b + c }{i + j + k }
\]"}, {"id": "s8", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
hence each given ratio is
\[
	=\frac{a }{i } = \frac{b }{j } = \frac{c }{k }
\]
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Since, $\frac{b + c - a }{j + k - i } = \frac{c + a - b }{k + i - j } = \frac{a + b - c }{i + j - k }$, therefore, each ratio is equal to $\frac{\textrm{sum of antecedents}}{\textrm{sum of consequents}}$, which equals $\frac{b + c - a + c + a - b + a + b - c }{j + k - i + k + i - j + i + j - k }$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Upon simplification, previous equation can be written as $\frac{a + b + c }{i + j + k }$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Multiplying $\frac{b + c - a }{j + k - i } = \frac{a + b + c }{i + j + k }$ by $\frac{j + k - i}{a + b +c}$, we get $\frac{b + c - a }{a + b + c } = \frac{j + k - i }{i + j + k }$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Further simplification will lead to $\frac{a }{a + b + c } = \frac{i }{i + j + k }$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Multiplying both sides by $\frac{a + b +c}{i}$, we get $\frac{a }{i } = \frac{a + b + c }{i + j + k }$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Beginning with $\frac{c + a - b}{k + i - j}=\frac{a + b +c}{i + j +k}$ and following the previously done steps, we can prove $\frac{b }{j } = \frac{a + b + c }{i + j + k }$ and starting from $\frac{a + b - c}{i + j - k}=\frac{a + b +c}{i + j +k}$ and following the same steps, we can prove $\frac{c }{k } = \frac{a + b + c }{i + j + k }$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}]
